intro: Agraulus brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved agraulus, is a small annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
